result.execSummary:
The defendant Julius A. Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius A. Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: non payment
undecided

Called at 1:17 PM. Julius Alloway appears in person and in custody with attorney Rick Cveykus. State appears by Charles Simono. Cveykus - amend #1 to misd possession of THC with repeater contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) with a $500 fine plus court costs, drug abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. State agrees. Alloway agrees. State moves to amend only count to misd possession of THC with a repeater contrary to 961.41(3g)(e) with a $500 fine plus all costs and surcharges. Court amends only count to misd possession of THC contrary to 9613.41(3g)(e) keeping the repeater allegation. Alloway pleads NC to amended count #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Cveykus - follow joint recommendation. Alloway withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: $500 fine plus costs and all surcharges totalling $1555.50 -  paid at $100.00/month commencing 12/15/14/CO, right to appeal, adjourned.
J.A.

Called at 1:16 PM. Julius Alloway appears in person and with counsel Rick Cveykus. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has been handed waiver of PH form. Cveykus and Alloway agree it will be waived today. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Cveykus has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG plea to only count. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 5/20/14 at 10:00 AM. If Cveykus' JT goes in another county, he will call to reschedule this.
